discussion.content: Universal

Selected Answer: D
Universal. Don’t confuse with global.
In a security policy, only the "universal" type will work with intra and interzone traffic.

https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/content/dam/pan/en_US/assets/pdf/datasheets/education/pcnsa-study-guide-latest.pdf

Page 101

questions.question_text: Which type of Security policy rule would match traffic flowing between the Inside zone and Outside zone, within the Inside zone, and within the Outside zone?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Per EDL formatting guidelines , IP address, Domain, or URL list should use wildcard value.
Answer should be AC.

Selected Answer: AD
I think AD, because: 

URL filtering is like *.domain.com - which is a wildcard
IP address is like: 10.10.10.* - which is a regex

Selected Answer: BC
IP can be manipulated using wild card (*) while URL can be manipulated using REGEX as any string. The answer must be BC
Answer BC

questions.question_text: What two actions can be taken when Implementing an exception to an External Dynamic List? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Exclude a URL entry by making use of wildcards
choices.B: Exclude a URL entry by making use of regular expressions
choices.C: Exclude an IP address by making use of wildcards
choices.D: Exclude an IP address by making use of regular expressions

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
GP is for mobile/VPN use

Answer is GlobalProtect
PCNSA 2021 page 14: GlobalProtect: GlobalProtect safeguards your mobile workforce by inspecting all traffic using your next-generation firewalls deployed as internet gateways, whether at the perimeter, in the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ), or in the cloud.
It is now prisma access.

questions.question_text: Which Palo Alto Networks firewall security platform provides network security for mobile endpoints by inspecting traffic deployed as internet gateways?

choices.D: Route with lowest metric is actively used.
choices.A: Path monitoring does not determine if route is useable.
choices.C: Path monitoring determines if route is useable.
choices.B: Route with highest metric is actively used.

questions.question_text:
Which two statements are correct regarding multiple static default routes when they are configured as shown in the image? (Choose two.)
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C and D is correct; PCNSA Study Guide Page 96 and 97
Link Monitoring looks at directly connected links, Path monitoring looks at links that are not directly connected but affect the traffic, so C & D are correct.

questions.question_text:
Given the Cyber-Attack Lifecycle diagram, identify the stage in which the attacker can run malicious code against a targeted machine.
//IMG//

discussion.content: correct

Selected Answer: A
. Exploitation:
In this stage, attackers deploy an exploit against a vulnerable application or system, typically using an exploit kit or weaponized document.
Exploitation

How is this not B?
Exploitation is getting a foothold. 
Installation is when you deliver a malicious payload.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A as per the study guide.

I think the answer is B. An exploit is not malicious, but allows the attacker to get access to a system and then run malicious code. The definition of the installation stage is "Installation: Once they’ve established an initial foothold, attackers will install malware in order to conduct further operations, such as maintaining access, persistence and escalating privileges."

Selected Answer: A
A is correct. https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/cyberpedia/how-to-break-the-cyber-attack-lifecycle
